9 <input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["T"]'/> The idea that investors can tailor their risk exposures based on common risk factors has become  known amongst as a smart beta strategy. 

10 <input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["F"]'/> We call the tendency to hang on to losers and sell winners the herd behavior. 

11 <input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["T"]'/> The relative wealth concerns bias suggests that investors care most about the performance of their portfolio relative to that of their peers. 

13 <input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["T"]'/> Loss aversion refers to the tendency of investors to prefer avoiding losses rather than acquiring equivalent gains. 

14 <input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["T"]'/> The availability heuristic can influence investment decisions by causing investors to overweight information that is readily available or easily recalled. 

15 <input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["F"]'/> Anchoring bias occurs when investors always rely on the purchase price of a security when making subsequent investment decisions. 

16 <input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["F"]'/> Recency bias involves investors placing greater emphasis on historical data compared to recent events. 

17 <input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["T"]'/> Prospect theory suggests that individuals evaluate potential gains and losses relative to a reference point, rather than in absolute terms.
